name: Luxury Jetsetter
tagline: First-class treatment, Park Hyatt robes, 3+ cents per point redemptions
description: You don’t just travel — you arrive. You want a full set of cards that handle high-end logistics, elite hotel treatment, and the finest dining, all while maintaining top-tier insurance.

slots.name: The Hub & Insurance
slots.description: Transfer partners + God-tier travel protection.

slots.name: Luxury Food & Dining
slots.description: 4x on worldwide dining and high-end grocery spend plus premium dining credits.

slots.name: Lifestyle & Chauffeur
slots.description: Retail credits (Saks/Lululemon) and premium airport transfers.

slots.name: Jetsetter Specialists
slots.description: The cards that unlock the 'Park Hyatt' lifestyle.

rules.title: Redemption Floor
rules.description: Never redeem for less than 2.0 cpp; your time is too valuable for low-yield points.

rules.title: The Airport Decider
rules.description: Prioritize Strata Elite if you value Admirals Club, or Platinum for Centurion/Delta lounges.

name: Wallet Freak
tagline: The Final Boss — Issuers Fear You
description: You run a precisely engineered collection based on the 'creator's wallet.' You hit every credit, use every lounge, and ensure every dollar spent on rent or dining is working toward a free flight.

slots.name: Travel & Lounge Hub
slots.description: The heavy hitters for lounge access, flight multipliers, and airline credits.

slots.name: The Hilton Status Duo
slots.description: The 'Double Play' for instant Diamond and Gold status plus high earn on hotel stays.

slots.name: Dining & Grocery Engine
slots.description: Maximum yield on every meal and grocery run.

slots.name: Rent & Everyday Protection
slots.description: Turning your mortgage/rent into points and protecting your hardware.

rules.title: The Hilton Meta
rules.description: Combine the Aspire's $250 resort credit with the Surpass's $200 Hilton credit to make luxury stays nearly free.

rules.title: Dining Diversification
rules.description: Use Savor for 4% on entertainment and CSP for 3x on dining to feed into the Chase ecosystem.

name: Points Strategist
tagline: Transfer Partner Only — 5+ cpp or bust
description: You view points as a currency to be traded. You build a whole setup that feeds into transfer partners for international business and first class.

slots.name: Transfer Hub Core
slots.description: The command centers for moving points to high-value partners like Hyatt, Flying Blue, and Virgin Atlantic.

slots.name: Daily Multiplier Feeders
slots.description: Building huge point balances through high-frequency daily spend in dining, groceries, and rotating categories.

slots.name: Lifestyle & Protection
slots.description: Essential travel protections and a non-category points floor for 'everything else' spend.

slots.name: The Specialist Multipliers
slots.description: Cards used surgically for their 5x-10x multipliers on specific categories or portals.

rules.title: No Portal Redemptions
rules.description: Unless it's a 10x earn rate on the Strata Elite or Sapphire Reserve to build the next bank; otherwise, points are strictly for transfer partners.

rules.title: Hyatt Rule
rules.description: Chase points always go to Hyatt unless a 30%+ transfer bonus exists elsewhere to a high-value airline partner.

name: Business Powerhouse
description: Your business spend is massive. You need a setup that handles heavy operations and rewards you with first-class travel for the whole team.

slots.name: The Category Destroyer
slots.description: The heavy hitters for high-spend business overhead like digital advertising, shipping, and telecom infrastructure.

slots.name: The Operational Core
slots.description: Infrastructure support featuring SaaS credits (Dell, Adobe, Indeed) and unlimited premium lounge access for business travel.

slots.name: Personal Essentials
slots.description: Protecting the founder's lifestyle with high-yield rewards on personal grocery, dining, and home delivery.

slots.name: The Specialist Catch-All
slots.description: Uncapped 2% to 2.5% back for high-limit equipment purchases or inventory spend that falls outside of bonus categories.

rules.title: Employee Card Stack
rules.description: Issue employee cards at no extra cost to maximize the 3-5x categories on every team meal, Uber, and office supply run.

rules.title: 35% Rebate Strategy
rules.description: Always use the Business Platinum 'Pay with Points' feature for flights to get a 35% points rebate, effectively boosting your redemption value.

name: Cashback Pragmatist
tagline: Points Are Cope. Cash Is King.
description: You want a simple, high-yield setup that puts actual dollars in your bank account. No transfer partners, no award charts, and no blackout dates—just cold, hard cash at the highest possible percentage.

slots.name: The Flat Rate Core
slots.description: Uncapped 2% (or more) on every single purchase. This is your default card when no other category applies.

slots.name: The 5% Category Nukes
slots.description: Surgical cards used to hit 5% cash back on your heaviest spending categories like groceries, dining, or home improvement.

slots.name: Lifestyle & Utility
slots.description: Boosters for recurring household bills, including 6% on streaming and groceries, or 5% on Amazon and utilities.

slots.name: The Specialist Booster
slots.description: Niche rewards for the road and retail, ensuring 4-5% back on Gas, EV charging, and Wholesale clubs.

rules.title: Index Fund Transfer
rules.description: Treat your cash back like an investment—automate monthly transfers from your rewards to a brokerage account.

rules.title: No Net AF
rules.description: A Pragmatist never loses money to a bank. If a card has an annual fee, its specific credits (like the Disney or Hulu credit) must make the card net-positive.

name: Foodie & Grocery King
description: Your food bill is your largest expense. You need a setup that treats every grocery run and restaurant visit as a high-yield investment, maximizing every calorie with credits and multipliers.

slots.name: The Hub & Travel
slots.description: Premium travel for food-motivated trips. These cards provide access to exclusive dining reservations (Resy/Chase) and luxury travel credits.

slots.name: The High-Yield Kitchen
slots.description: The absolute rewards ceiling for home cooking and delivery. These cards offer up to 6% back on groceries and consistent dining rewards.

slots.name: Foodie Specialists
slots.description: Surgical tools for takeout, delivery apps, and international dining where you need high multipliers without the high annual fee.

rules.title: The $6,000 Grocery Pivot
rules.description: Maximize the 6% rate on the Blue Cash Preferred early in the year, then pivot to the Amex Gold (4x) or Savor (3%) to avoid the 1% drop-off.

rules.title: Delivery App Dominance
rules.description: Always link your Chase cards for DashPass and your Amex Gold for monthly Uber Cash/Grubhub credits—never pay a delivery fee again.

name: Family Freak
tagline: Groceries for an army, Disney bundle, Costco runs — all maxed
description: You manage the household and the budget. You need a setup that handles high-volume spend at wholesale clubs, provides entertainment for the kids, and ensures top-tier protection for family vacations.

slots.name: The Family Hub
slots.description: The command center for family logistics. Includes priority lounge access for the whole crew and world-class travel insurance for peace of mind.

slots.name: Household Essentials & Kids
slots.description: Maximizing the recurring bills: 6% on the grocery run, 5% on Amazon boxes, and credits that fully cover the Disney/Hulu bundle.

slots.name: Big Box Specialists
slots.description: Wholesale dominance. Specifically chosen for high-yield returns at Costco and Sam's Club where other category cards typically fail.

rules.title: Wholesale Stacking
rules.description: During the rotating 5% wholesale quarters on Freedom or Discover, buy gift cards at the warehouse to 'lock in' the 5% rate for the rest of the year.

rules.title: The Protection Protocol
rules.description: Always pay the family cell phone bill with the card providing the highest claim limit (e.g., Ink Preferred or Bilt) to cover the whole family's hardware.

name: Gas/EV Charging Freak
tagline: 5%+ on every gallon/kWh or civil unrest
description: Your life happens on the road. You need a setup that handles gas, EV charging, transit, and roadside emergencies flawlessly while maximizing every mile driven.

slots.name: Fuel & Energy Core
slots.description: The high-yield engines for your tank or battery. These cards offer permanent 4-5% rewards on Gas and EV charging.

slots.name: Lifestyle & Pitstops
slots.description: Credits and multipliers for the 'road warrior' lifestyle, covering morning coffee, quick bites, and transit costs.

slots.name: Roadside & Travel Support
slots.description: Lounge access for long-distance layovers and premium protection/dispatch services for peace of mind on the highway.

rules.title: Fuel App Stacking
rules.description: Always link your 5% card to apps like Shell, Exxon, or BP to stack credit card rewards with per-gallon merchant discounts.

rules.title: The Roadside Priority
rules.description: Ensure your primary 'Catch-All' card includes Roadside Dispatch or primary Rental Car Insurance to avoid out-of-pocket costs during emergencies.

name: Online Shopping Addict
tagline: 10–20% back online or I’m not buying
description: You click 'Buy Now' daily. Your setup is engineered to reward every Amazon box, retail portal, and PayPal checkout, stacking credits with multipliers for maximum digital yield.

slots.name: The Digital Hub
slots.description: The heavy hitters for rotating 5% categories and portal accelerators. Essential for maximizing PayPal quarters.

slots.name: The Amazon & Marketplace Core
slots.description: High-limit rewards for the world's largest retailer. Ensures you never earn just 1%.

slots.name: Lifestyle & Retail Credits
slots.description: Cards that pay you to shop. These provide direct statement credits for Saks, Lululemon, Dell, and Best Buy.

slots.name: Shopping Specialists
slots.description: Surgical tools for niche sites and general online spend.

rules.title: Rakuten Stacking Rule
rules.description: Never checkout without checking Rakuten. Stacking card multipliers with portal cash back is the only way to reach 10%+ effective returns.

rules.title: The PayPal Key Strategy
rules.description: During the 5% PayPal quarters (Chase/Discover), route every possible digital bill through PayPal to hit the cap instantly.

name: Simple Minimalist
tagline: One or Two Cards. Zero Drama. Maximum Peace.
description: You want the highest return for the lowest effort. This setup focuses on 'set it and forget it' cards.

slots.name: The Everything Hub
slots.description: The 'Catch-All' core. These cards offer high flat-rate rewards on every single purchase.

slots.name: Everyday Essentials
slots.description: The 'Support' layer. Pick one card here that covers your biggest recurring expense.

rules.title: The Single-App Strategy
rules.description: Choose your hub card based on where you already bank (e.g., Chase, Wells Fargo, or Citi).

rules.title: The Annual Fee Test
rules.description: Only keep cards with an annual fee if the credits are automated; otherwise, stick to $0 fee cards.

name: Yuppie Flexer
tagline: Heavy metal, Centurion access, bottle service energy
description: You want a setup that looks as good as the rewards. You prioritize heavy metal cards and elite airport lounges.

slots.name: Urban Dining & Food
slots.description: Premium metal cards for high-end restaurants and delivery.

slots.name: Lifestyle & Flex
slots.description: The 'status' symbols. These offer luxury retail credits and fitness benefits.

slots.name: Flex Specialists
slots.description: Cards with the best physical aesthetic and weight.

rules.title: Lounge Hierarchy
rules.description: Always arrive early for Centurion Lounge or Sapphire Lounge access; Priority Pass is secondary.

rules.title: Credit Flex
rules.description: Maximize the Saks and Lululemon retail credits quarterly to keep your wardrobe fresh.

name: Value Traveler
tagline: Premium perks, net-negative annual fee, minimal effort
description: You travel often but refuse to pay net fees. You need a setup where the credits fully pay for the annual fee.

slots.name: The Net-Zero Hubs
slots.description: Premium travel hubs where credits are worth more than the fee.

slots.name: Daily Value Earners
slots.description: No-AF multipliers for everyday non-travel spending.

slots.name: Security & International Utility
slots.description: Cards specifically chosen for TSA Pre/Global Entry and zero FX fees.

slots.name: Travel Value Specialists
slots.description: High-value specialty cards that offer anniversary free nights.

rules.title: The Net-Zero Math
rules.description: Ensure the credits (Travel, Hotel, or Anniversary Points) equal or exceed the AF.

rules.title: Foreign Fee Audit
rules.description: Never carry a card abroad that charges a 3% transaction fee.

name: Category Hunter
description: You live for quarterly activation day. You want a setup that hits 5-10% in a different category every three months.

slots.name: The Rotating Hub
slots.description: The heavy hitters for quarterly 5% categories.

slots.name: The Custom Lock Core
slots.description: Permanent high-yield categories that adjust automatically.

slots.name: Lifestyle & Utility Boosters
slots.description: Targeted multipliers for fixed high-spend areas like Gas or Phone plans.

slots.name: Hunter Specialists
slots.description: Specialty tools for catching the 'overflow' spend.

rules.title: 12:01 AM Activation
rules.description: Set a calendar alert to activate your quarterly categories immediately.

rules.title: The Gift Card Hedge
rules.description: Buy gift cards for future use if you haven't hit the spending cap by the end of the quarter.

name: Student Starter
tagline: Build 800+ credit while eating out & Ubering
description: You're building your future. You need a setup that costs $0 in annual fees.

slots.name: The Starter Hub
slots.description: Student-specific cards designed for easy approval.

slots.name: Food & Fun
slots.description: Maximum yield on eating out and entertainment.

slots.name: Lifestyle & Protection
slots.description: Essential zero-fee utility including cell phone protection.

slots.name: Credit Building Specialists
slots.description: The fallback options for those with no credit history.

rules.title: Pay in Full
rules.description: Never carry a balance; interest charges wipe out any rewards value.

rules.title: The GPA Bonus
rules.description: Claim your $20 statement credit each school year you maintain a 3.0 GPA with Discover.

name: Hotel Status Chaser
description: You prioritize where you sleep. You want instant elite status across all major chains.

slots.name: The Hilton Core
slots.description: Instant Diamond or Gold status.

slots.name: The Marriott Hub
slots.description: Cards that unlock Marriott Platinum or Gold status immediately.

slots.name: Hyatt & IHG Specialists
slots.description: The best cards for the 'loyalty sweet spots.'

slots.name: Lifestyle & Luxury Portals
slots.description: Cards that provide access to luxury hotel collections.

rules.title: Resort Credit Timing
rules.description: Use your Hilton resort credits semi-annually to ensure you stay net-positive.

rules.title: The Hyatt Transfer Rule
rules.description: Always prioritize transferring Chase points to Hyatt; the value beats other chains.

name: Airline Companion Pass Chaser
tagline: Companion flies free, free bags, lounge access
description: You travel with a partner. You need 'two for one' travel and airport lounge access.

slots.name: Companion Pass & Certificate Hubs
slots.description: The primary engines for 'Buy One Get One' travel.

slots.name: The United & Delta Core
slots.description: Cards for domestic airline perks and priority boarding.

slots.name: Airline & Logistics Specialists
slots.description: Cards that handle checked bags and Global Entry credits.

slots.name: Lifestyle & Airport Dining
slots.description: Credits that fund the journey and lounge snacks.

rules.title: Certificate Mandatory
rules.description: Never let your annual companion certificate expire; it's the core value driver.

rules.title: Free Bag Stack
rules.description: Always check a bag if the card provides it for free to save overhead space.
